extendedIngredients.name: feta cheese
extendedIngredients.original: 1 cup Greek feta cheese, crumbled (4 ounces)

extendedIngredients.name: olive oil
extendedIngredients.original: 1/4 cup plus 2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil

extendedIngredients.name: red cabbage
extendedIngredients.original: 2 pounds red cabbage, thinly sliced (8 cups)

extendedIngredients.name: red onions
extendedIngredients.original: 2 medium red onions, very thinly sliced

title: Linguine with Red Cabbage
summary: Linguine with Red Cabbage might be just the side dish you are searching for. For 86 cents per serving, this recipe covers 17% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. This recipe serves 8. One portion of this dish contains around 11g of protein, 11g of fat, and a total of 348 calories. This recipe is liked by 1 foodies and cooks. It is a good option if you're following a vegetarian diet. If you have salt and pepper, onions, linguine, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes approximately 50 minutes. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 75%. This score is solid. Similar recipes include Spiralized Red Cabbage Kohlrabi Slaw with Cilantro Vinaigrette, Linguine with Red Cabbage, and Garlicky linguine with cabbage & anchovy.
instructions: In a large, deep skillet, heat the olive oil. Add the sliced onions, cover and cook over moderately low heat, stirring occasionally, until they are very soft, about 10 minutes. Add the minced garlic and cook, stirring, until fragrant, about 3 minutes. Add the sliced red cabbage, cover and cook, stirring occasionally, until the cabbage is tender, about 20 minutes.                                              Meanwhile, in a large pot of boiling salted water, cook the linguine until it is al dente. Drain the pasta well, reserving 1 cup of the pasta cooking water. Return the pasta to the pot.                                              Scrape the cabbage over the pasta. Add the reserved pasta cooking water and toss well. Season with salt and pepper. Transfer to bowls, top with the feta and serve.

steps.step: In a large, deep skillet, heat the olive oil.
Add the sliced onions, cover and cook over moderately low heat, stirring occasionally, until they are very soft, about 10 minutes.
Add the minced garlic and cook, stirring, until fragrant, about 3 minutes.
Add the sliced red cabbage, cover and cook, stirring occasionally, until the cabbage is tender, about 20 minutes.
Meanwhile, in a large pot of boiling salted water, cook the linguine until it is al dente.
Drain the pasta well, reserving 1 cup of the pasta cooking water. Return the pasta to the pot.
Scrape the cabbage over the pasta.
Add the reserved pasta cooking water and toss well. Season with salt and pepper.
Transfer to bowls, top with the feta and serve.
